Comments_List: This course helped me develop a vast body of knowledge about the Sephardic diaspora, the Judeo-Spanish language, and Judeo-Spanish culture.  I developed skills in close reading, literary analysis, historical reasoning, and more.
An incredible wealth of knowledge about Sephardi Jews, the Ottoman Empire, the Atlantic World, and theories of ethnicity and diaspora. I also became a more inquisitive and curious historian!
I learned that there are many unique types of Jews and its dangerous to overlook their differences.

This course was very strong.  Prof. Gonzalez is a wonderful instructor and all of the readings were very well chosen.  Prof. Gonzalez did a great job of making the class discussion dynamic and including everyone in the conversation and was very interested in ensuring that all of us understood what was going on and were learning.  The emphasis on written assignments over fact-based tests was also very much appreciated (and served, I feel, as a better metric of understanding).
Absolutely incredible course! Immensely rich and textured, with perfectly curated readings, fruitful and engaging discussions, and a brilliant professor.
This course was amazing. I loved the fascinating readings and small class discussions
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student.  If you have the chance, take this!  You will learn so much and have a great time doing so.
Incredible course! Incredible professor, interesting material, and you walk away from the class with a broadened historical perspective and new ways of approaching the past.
Yes. I learned so much about Judaism and my own Judaism in a fun and challenging way.
